text: Mount Gilliland, is a mountain in the Solitude Range of the Hart Ranges in Northern British Columbia. Named for Canadian Army Battery Quartermaster Sergeant Norman Walter Gilliland, from Dawson Creek; serving with 3 Light Anti-Aircraft Regiment, Royal Regiment of Canadian Artillery, attached to the 2nd Canadian Infantry Division when he died 29 September 1944, age 44. He is buried in Wijnegem Communal Cemetery, Belgium. == References == Category:Mountains of British Columbia Category:Canadian Army soldiers Category:Dawson Creek
title: Mount Gilliland
